page.title: 15GREAT MEOLS:AGRICULTURE.
page.content: Although primarily a residential area, {12 Hectares}of the grid area are used for farming, centered mainly around {Reedes Farm. The light,well-drained,sandy soil is ideal for a variety of crops which are grown on a market-garden basis.These include Brassicas,root vegetables, salad crops, soft fruits,tomatoes (under glass)and potatos,all of which find a ready wholesale market in the industrial hinterland of Merseyside. Some produce is sold direct to the public via farm shops. Fields are rotated and fallow land, under grass, provides winter feed for dairy herds in the region and helps to provide fodder for the riding schools in the vicinity. Over the past 10 years increasing demand for homes has resulted in much farmland being developed for housing.
